results.title: An Untitled film
results.creator_credit: David Gladwell and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed black and white film in slow motion of life on a farm - dogs, cats, chickens, horses, a man shovelling and burning grass, and a boy watching a chicken being strangled. These strong images are accompanied by experimental music that compliments this well shot film.
results.description: Beautifully photographed black and white film in slow motion of life on a farm - dogs, cats, chickens, horses, a man shovelling and burning grass, and a boy watching a chicken being strangled. results.title: Untitled: five Australian artists
results.brief_description: The work of five contemporary Australian sculptors - Tony Trembath, Ian Bracegirdle, Ross Grounds, Paul Stevenson-Ryan and Ray Woolard. The sculptors talk about their avant-garde sculptures, and see them as reflections on today’s society. They cite ecology, conservation and preserving the past as being important motivators in their work, and see their art as a way of living out their fantasies

results.title: Unmarried mothers
results.creator_credit: Michael Grigsby, Elaine Grand and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: A report on illegitimacy in Britain. Eight unmarried mothers are interviewed before and after the birth of their babies. They talk about contraception, abortion, adoption and the problems they face in society and in supporting a baby. The work of the National Council of the Unmarried Mother and Child, Mothers and Baby Homes and the social worker is shown. Narrated by Douglas Keay.

results.title: The Unlucky country
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Denys Brown and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: South Vietnam, a developing country facing the process of improving standards of living, health and education, against a background of constant dissension and war - the dual objectives to win a war and develop a country. Discusses the role of Australian Task Forces in establishing security and providing aid for civil development. Shows the work of the three medical teams.

results.title: Understanding the deaf (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows classroom activities in the Lutheran School for the Deaf in Detroit. Emphasises the teaching of speech, lip-reading, and language and shows the interaction of deaf children with their parents.

results.title: Understanding aggression
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, Ronald H. Riley and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: Intended for teaching psychiatric nursing, this is a study of aggression, a normal reaction which the well-balanced person learns to control but which presents a difficult problem in the psychiatric hospital.

results.title: Umpiring netball
results.creator_credit: Lee Wright, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: The role of the umpire in netball, and a summary of the rules of the game. Two opposing teams demonstrate the application of the rules relating to personal contact, centre passes, rough play, obstruction, holding the ball, bouncing, free passes, footwork etc.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Wright, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: Ultrasonic examination of the brain in children
results.brief_description: A specialist medical film describing a new ultrasonic technique for the examination of the brain in children, developed by Australia’s National Acoustics Laboratories and the Royal Hospital for Women, Sydney The technique provides for accurate visualisation of the size and shape of the lateral and third ventricles and of space-occupying lesions, and provides much the same information as X-ray air studies

results.title: Udaipur, city of lakes
results.creator_credit: P.R.S. Pillay, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: This beautiful lakeside city of India attracts tourists from all over the world. Udaipur is a city of palaces, surrounded by hills and lakes essential for irrigation which also enhance the landscape. Wonderful gardens, temples decorated with carved marble and a tower of victory built in the 15th century are examples of the beauty of this city. These religious people love festivals; with a boat procession on the lake and girls wearing colorful saris.
